security: These memoranda document meetings and briefings with various individuals, including members of Congress, journalists, and foreign officials. Sharing these details could reveal the CIA's areas of interest, its relationships with the media, and its intelligence-gathering activities.
summary: These are memoranda for the record detailing DCI's (Director of Central Intelligence) meetings and activities from April to July 1964, including discussions with government officials, journalists, and foreign representatives on topics ranging from Southeast Asia to Soviet policy.
summary_one_paragraph: This compilation of memoranda for the record spans from April to July 1964, outlining the daily activities and meetings of the DCI with various individuals, including government officials like the Secretary of Defense and Secretary of State, members of Congress, journalists, and foreign representatives. The meetings cover a broad range of subjects, including discussions on Southeast Asia (Laos, Vietnam), Soviet policy, the Warren Commission, SST (Supersonic Transport), NRO (National Reconnaissance Office), and briefings for presidential candidates. The memoranda also note the preparation of meeting reports and associated files for specific topics.
title: Memorandum for the Record: DCI Meetings and Activities April-July 1964
